intro: Parentucellia, commonly known as the "Mexican sunflower," is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to the Americas, particularly Mexico and Central America, and is characterized by its vibrant, orange-yellow ray flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Parentucellia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
